data.title: Good Food, good prices
data.text: The Royal Street Cafe is one I would recommend for anybody who is looking for a good meal at a good price. We always enjoy coming here. The food is not fancy or gourmet, just hearty. The staff is friendly and efficient. Among other reasons we enjoy this place is that it has a homey atmosphere. You don't feel like you are in some corporate idea of a restaurant.

data.title: Fantastic Service - Very Friendly
data.text: Wish I could rate this place higher, but I can't. First let me say the service and friendliness is tops, it's the best. I also like the atmosphere, just laid back!  However as much as I thought the breakfast was going to be tops, it was a let down, nothing special.  First the grits is the big test and to serve watery tasteless grits is really a letdown.  Girts isn't that hard, just cook them correctly, perhaps with a little cream or half n half and serve them fluffy, not soup.  As for the eggs the cook needs to learn how to cook eggs and by that I mean cook them.  I hate clear liquid running out of my eggs.  Over easy means whites done, yoke running. Sorry for being a little disappointed, our service was just fantastic and they cooked our eggs over and said if not right they would do them again.  I cannot say enough about how hard they strive to make the customer happy.  This is a good place and I will try it again.

data.title: Great Breakfast Spot
data.text: We stayed at a hotel across the street. We were looking for a place for breakfast and were recommended this place by locals. The outside of the building isn't impressive, but don't let that stop you. Prices are fair. The food is good and the service was good.

data.title: quick & yummy food
data.text: this little cafe has lots of personality from all of the employees.......they have a wonderful taco salad.....great breakfasts and the BEST chicken salad ever

data.title: Nice surprise
data.text: We stayed at the Candlewood across the street and stopped here for breakfast before leaving town. The food was delicious and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend.

data.title: Convenient location downtown
data.text: The breakfast is absolutely wonderful. A hidden treasure in downtown Mobile,  Al. Reasonable price, friendly people and great food.

data.title: Our office regularly orders from Royal Street Cafe
data.text:
I basically have two favorites: Breakfast in a Cup (grits with sausage, egg or egg white & cheese) and the Salad Duo (it's such a large portion that it serves as both lunch & dinner). Their black bean soup and taco salad are my co-workers' favorites. Someone always checks for their daily lunch specials via FB.

Kevin & his crew are great. If you happen to have forgotten to bring your potluck item, give them a call early for an emergency pan of mac'n cheese or something. 👍🏼

data.title: Great lunch on back patio!
data.text: This place is very old feeling and needs to be updated. You get a Mobile dirty feel which is typical of most of the city. Everything in mobile is run down so I can't expect them to update when they get so much LOCAL business. All of the business people eat here for lunch cause it is quick and pretty good food. Not really healthy but you are in Alabama don't expect anything healthy to stay open for more than a month. Overall great service, nice back patio, good food, just old and run down.

data.title: Skip it!
data.text: We only  went for breakfast but its over at 10:30, we got there at 11 and the place was empty! I wanted to leave because the menu did not my call attention but my friends wanted to just eat. How bad can it be? Umm bad! We ordered lunch and it was terrible. The hot turkey sandwich was a cold hogie, the chips are lays that they throw on your plate next to your food. Unless there is nowhere else to eat in Mobile including gas station sandwiches then go there if thats not the case,then skip it!

data.title: Good quick lunch option
data.text: I was downtown for business and grabbed a quick lunch at this place for locals. The service was extremely friendly and very fast. The prices were pretty good. I ordered a cheeseburger and paid a little extra for a side salad instead of chips. The food didn't blow me away, but it was good. I was very impressed with how fast I got in and out, which matters on a business trip. I would return.

data.title: Good place if staying nearby
data.text: We were staying at the Battle House down the street.  Three of our family members went here for lunch and it was good.  The place was a little dirty, but the food wasn't bad. It reminds me of southern local cafes.

data.title: Nice, convenient place for breakfast
data.text: Food was good.  Very pleasant little place "down the street from the Battle House Hotel"  Had breakfast there twice during a recent Mobile stay.

data.title: Kevin and Crew
data.text: Kevin and crew are really helpful - if you don't see something on the menu and they have it they will fix for you - they have a different lunch special every day.

data.title: The ambiance ain't much but the food more than makes up!
data.text: Just a working man's diner type place but the food was spectacular.  The soups are all hand crafted.  Try the blue plate special.  You will be glad you did.

data.title: Lovely little Place
data.text: Had a lunch at the Royal, the portion was massive and very tasty. The Staff had seen us out the night before and took time to talk to us and were very friendly. The value was good and well worth a visit

data.title: Thanks but No Thanks!!
data.text: I recently visited this little eatery. I work down the street from them. I heard so many good things about the taco salad and I was eager to try it out. I walked four blocks from my place of employment and walked in the front door. I was second in line during a lunch rush. After waiting patiently until the person in front was served, I was skipped by at least 10 people coming out of the dining area. I blame the cashier, an older white haired gentleman, because he never even acknowledged me. It was only until one nice lady said to me, " They skipped you didn't they", I said yes but it's not their fault it's his. He looked at me and said Merry X-mas, send us some business and comped my meal. I was still a little upset, on a good note the taco salad was good. Just remember keep the line straight, no veering to the left!!

data.title: The Green salad is to die for....
data.text: I had shrimp, which was Ok, but not fantastic, but the salad was outstanding!!  The service was very good too, and the prices are reasonable.

data.title: Excellent FOOD for a GREAT price
data.text: Breakfast is the best! You can order, eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast for less than $5.00 The staff go out of their way to turn you into a returning customer.

data.title: Best kept secret in Mobile
data.text: A great local favorite downtown.  Breakfast is excellent!  Lunch has a nice choice of sandwiches, soups and salads.  Taco Salad is best I have ever had.  Usually one special hot lunch each day.  Closes at 2 pm.  Reasonably priced.

data.title: Great Breakfast-Great Price!
data.text: Stayed across from this small restaurant...right behind Candlewood Suites.  The shop opens early...French toast was awesome as were the eggs and waffles...a favorite stop for me each time I am in Mobile
